151733.description:
From publisher blurb:

You know it's your destiny!

For some tinkers, their first automaton is not merely a tool, but also their best friend. Together, tinker and Rusty, for that was its name, adventured throughout the land, righting wrongs, defeating slavering demihumans, and looting fantastic treasures from long forgotten ruins featuring both Euclidean and non-Euclidean geometry.

Then they met their first dragon.

The encounter was a debacle. Though brave to the end, for poor Rusty was built by a such a novice that he was effectively mindless, the tinker's first creation and best friend could not prevail over such a creature. Tears in his eyes, the tinker watched in horror as his beloved friend fell before the lizard's onslaught. Nothing went right. Rusty couldn't block. Rusty couldn't dodge. Rusty couldn't do anything that the tinker himself found easy!

Escaping with what scraps of his beloved companion he could, the tinker immediately set to work on a new and improved Rusty. Bigger to take punishment, stronger to deliver it, the new Rusty was a marvel of engineering; however, despite his best efforts, a larger Rusty was not better at blocking and dodging, for a larger Rusty was not a smarter Rusty. Still, the automaton was impressive. Indeed, such a hulking machine could easily swallow its creator whole.

Or carry it.

After a few simple modifications, the world's first Super Mega Ultra Mecha made headlines by making suplexing a dragon its first order of business.

When it comes to going big or going home, the mechgineer and his Super Mega Ultra Mecha take first prize. Inspired by giant robot cartoons and the power of friendship, this prestige class for the tinker base class believes that every threat that can't be destroyed by excessive electrocution or unnecessary amounts of alchemical firepower can simply be punched into the stratosphere.

Whereas a standard tinker commands squadrons of small automatons, the mechgineer only ever has a single megadroid or gigadroid and his alpha out at any one time. Experienced mechgineers go further, combining their two deployed automatons to produce a Super Mega Ultra Mecha, a massive automaton that bristles with the weaponry of over three standard automatons. Once combined, this Super Mega Ultra Mecha gains access to a number of Super Mega Ultra Subroutines, as well as the mechgineer's Epiphany, a powerful capstone ability selected from a list of offensive and defensive options.

Together, the mechgineer and his best friend are an unstoppable force anywhere the ceilings are at least fifteen feet high.

151734.name: Bobi
151734.description:
Bobi is a new fast paced and addictive game with one very simple goal, to get rid of all your cards before everyone else, because no one likes to lose.

Play in large groups and take it in turn to try and fire through a round with the same colour, but watch out because if you’ve played the highest card and someone else doesn’t have that colour you may be in for a very unpleasant surprise.

Play begins with the roll of a dice to decide the starting colour and after that the player holding the 'Bobi' card of that colour starts the game. Each player then takes it in turns to play a card of the same colour until each player has played one card to end the turn.

The next turn begins with the player who player the highest card on the last go and continues until players have no cards left in their hand. However if you don't have a card of the current colour you can play any card you want and force the player who has played the current highest to pick up all the cards in play.

151735.name: Anduin (Issue 75 - Aug 2002)
151735.description:
This issues provides the second (concluding) part of the Fading Suns adventure Das Auge Gottes (first part in issue 73), and two other adventures, one again for Fading Suns, one for DSA.
Articles on submarines of the 19th and early 20th century, Viking boats and a German PbF community, the usual NPC corner, recipes, comic, and reviews round the issue off.

151736.name: AIEEE!!!
151736.description:
User Summary:

One of five different minimalist RPG games using three stats: MIND, BODY and SPIRIT. Each game gives rules for a different genre and includes a short rulebook, an even shorter adventure book and a folded 8.5" x 11" containing charts, tables and a blank, square grid. Each game has "666th Edition" printed on the cover.

The creators of these games only identify themselves as "WHA*T*HE*LL PROD." and "Pantherine Writers' Group" of Kansas City, MO.

"AIEEE!!!" is designed for playing in the Horror genre. It includes a 46-page rulebook and a 10-page adventure ("Australian Werewolf in Traction").

151737.name: WHACKPOW!
151737.description:
User Summary:

One of five different minimalist RPG games using three stats: MIND, BODY and SPIRIT. Each game gives rules for a different genre and includes a short rulebook, an even shorter adventure book and a folded 8.5" x 11" containing charts, tables and a blank, square grid. Each game has "666th Edition" printed on the cover.

The creators of these games only identify themselves as "WHA*T*HE*LL PROD." and "Pantherine Writers' Group" of Kansas City, MO.

"WHACKPOW!" is designed for playing in the Martial Arts genre. It includes a 34-page rulebook and a 10-page adventure ("DEATHQUEST").

151738.name: !STOBOR
151738.description:
User Summary:

One of five different minimalist RPG games using three stats: MIND, BODY and SPIRIT. Each game gives rules for a different genre and includes a short rulebook, an even shorter adventure book and a folded 8.5" x 11" containing charts, tables and a blank, square grid. Each game has "666th Edition" printed on the cover.

The creators of these games only identify themselves as "WHA*T*HE*LL PROD." and "Pantherine Writers' Group" of Kansas City, MO.

"!STOBOR" is designed for playing in the Giant Robot genre. It includes a 46-page rulebook and a 10-page adventure ("THE ARENA").

151739.name: CYBERJUNK
151739.description:
User Summary:

One of five different minimalist RPG games using three stats: MIND, BODY and SPIRIT. Each game gives rules for a different genre and includes a short rulebook, an even shorter adventure book and a folded 8.5" x 11" containing charts, tables and a blank, square grid. Each game has "666th Edition" printed on the cover.

The creators of these games only identify themselves as "WHA*T*HE*LL PROD." and "Pantherine Writers' Group" of Kansas City, MO.

"CYBERJUNK" is designed for playing in the Cyberpunk genre. It includes a 34-page rulebook and a 10-page adventure ("THE PACKAGE").

151741.description: Collection of Army Lists for use with "War Games Rules 3000 BC to 1485 AD" also published by Wargames Research Group. Contains army lists for 60 different Ancient Armies of the time period, mostly through-out Europe and surrounding the Mediterranean, but does include the Han Chinese 200 BC to 200 AD. These Army List specifically support the 6th Edition of the War Games Rules.
151741.name: Army Lists Book One: 3000 BC – 75 AD

9398.name: War Games Rules  3000 BC to 1485 AD

151742.name: Historia
151742.description:
In Historia the player takes control of a realm in the eve of civilization. As ruler you shape the fate of your realm over the course of the centuries, trying with all your might to raise it high above all others. Your goal is to increase the four attributes of your realm, Stability, Power, Culture and Wealth, by taking control of provinces on the map, constructing markets, cities and palaces and playing idea cards that define your form of government, religion, military organization and other aspects of your society.

Each round you are faced with a decisive event in the history of the realm. As ruler it rest upon your shoulders to decide how the situation should be handled. When the peasants rise up in anger for an example, will you soothe their feelings or crush them with an iron fist? An opponent will read the result of your actions in a History book with over 200 paragraphs.

At the end of a game you will have experienced a rich and unique history of your own, whether you won the game or not.


I Historia tar du makten över ett rike som reser sig ur civilisationens vagga. Under århundradenas lopp formar du dess öde, i strävan att resa riket högt över alla andra och så nå ära och odödligt minne. Sätt plogen i obrukat land för att föda din växande befolkning, eller kuva dina grannars undersåtar med erövrarens rätt. Sprid din kultur till andra folk, hungrande efter civilisationens ljus och frukter. Under spelets gång kommer du att inrätta idéer som definierar rikets styrelseskick, religion militär organisation och andra aspekter av samhället.

Varje tur ställs du dock för en avgörande händelse i rikets historia och som makthavare är det på dina axlar ansvaret vilar att fatta beslut om hur situationen skall hanteras. När bönderna gör uppror i vred och oförstånd, skall du då mana till besinning eller krossa resningen i blod? Och vad gör du när riket drabbas av krig, pest eller gudarnas vrede? Resultatet av dina val läses ur en händelsebok med över 200 paragrafer.

I slutet av spelet kommer du att ha upplevt en spännande och unik historia, oavsett som vunnit eller förlorat.

151743.description: This is a trick taking card game with a 40 card deck. The deck is made up of four suits: purple, green, red, and blue. In each suit, some of the cards have duck pictures (Daisy, Donald, Scrooge, etc.). These are the point cards, with their point values shown on each card. The point value is different from these cards' play value, however. By playing cards, players take tricks and try to collect 120 points of point cards to win.
151743.name: Walt Disney's Donald Duck Game

151744.name: Trap the Rat
151744.description:
One player is the rat, trying to move across the board's yellow squares to one of the cheese squares. The other player is the trapper, trying to completely surround and trap the rat.

The rat player moves first, rolling the die and moving from the start square orthogonally that many squares. Then the trapper rolls the die and places that many fences on the board in the slots between squares. There are 5 total fences in the game. Once all fences have been placed, the trapper must use the already placed fences.

The game ends when either the rat cannot move, or the rat reaches a cheese square on the opposite end of the board.

The d6 is missing, so I'm unsure of its marks, but the instructions indicate that it has at least 1 blank spot, and it's reasonable to assume it goes no higher than 3, since a higher roll would be an automatic win for the trapper.

151746.name: The Black Fortress: Death Master Version 2.0
151746.description:
From publisher blurb:

For well over a thousand years this impenetrable and mysterious stronghold, set deep in the heart of the Plane of the Dead, has remained a silent observer to the events transpiring upon the surface of Netherworld, a fortress meant to house the deepest and darkest secrets of arcane necromancy until the end of time. Unknown to even the most experienced of magic-users, the Black Fortress is also the last location of the Black Skull Staff, an artifact of arcane sorcery rumored strong enough to destroy the deadliest threat to Netherworld's continued existence, the Greater Demon Holofax. Equally as dangerous is the staff's last known owner, an enigmatic wizard known only as the Death Master.

Intended for a party of 4 to 6 brave adventurers of 8th level to 10th level Dungeons and Dragon's characters, this module was designed under the Open Gaming LicenseTM and the D20 System TM created by Wizards of the Coast.

Module Highlights Include:

Full Color Cover Art by Wayne Reynolds, one of the industry's premiere artists.
90% all inclusive module is ready to play, meaning most of the monsters, characters, spells, feats, and items are included in the Appendix so you don't have to stop the game to look up things.
4 original pre-generated characters ready to combat the undead threat and tackle The Black Fortress.
A horde of original monsters like the Abominations, the Kthuloi, the Cobalt Behemoth, and The Dark Harvester, to test your player's mettle.
All new creature templates like the Unliving and the Half Undead.
New feats, spells, and magical items like Vampiric Rage, Mist Form Mastery, Spine Demon, and the Scimitar of Cleansing Flames.




Highlights of the New 2nd Edition!!!

Completely clickable Table of Contents for ease of reference so DMs can go right to the sections they need to.
Revamped time traveling based storyline is easier to follow and complete for even newbie DMs.
Uber Bosses have been revised to allow a typical group of PCs to take em on!
Demon Slayer and Death Slayer previews let players and DMs alike get more info about adventuring in the Netherworld Campaign Setting.
Detailed rules for PCs traveling in the Courtyard Maze and the Black Fortress.
New Encounter Levels for those times when the PCs want to Hack 'n' Slash.
More Maps, More Monsters, More Madness!!!

151748.name: Level 5
151748.description:
From the inlay

Trapped inside the alien space pod, your only hope of escape is to reach the renowned Level-5. Preventing you from reaching your goal are the ferocious Cybernauts, war robots that are programmed to cause maximum destruction, and worse still, you cannot kill them, for they will only regenerate into new forms, even more dangerous and destructive than before.
Trapped and alone, with limited resources and no chance of help, you must use your skill and ingenuity to survive.
But remember, your time is running out!
An all action arcade adventure for the Spectrum.

User Summary

The back of the inlay, and the instructions, state that there is a two player option, but there is no such option on the main menu.

151749.name: Spectrum Chess
151749.description:
From the inlay (Paxman Promotions compilation re-release)

An excellent chess programme with seven levels of play. Features include castling, en-passant, save game routine and analysis of game situation. The computer can also prompt moves for the novice player if requested.

Credits:

Author: C. A. Thornton

151750.name: Spectrum Chess II
151750.description:
User Summary

Spectrum Chess II is a development of the original Spectrum Chess.

Instead of selecting from six levels as in the original, the player now selects how much time the Spectrum is given to 'think' about a move, in seconds, from 1 to 999. However the player can always force the computer to play the best move it has currently found.

Credits:

Author: C. A. Thornton

151751.name: Skoklaarg
151751.description: Skoklaarg is a two-player, abstract strategy board game that is played on a 5x9 board. Each player commands one monarch and sixteen minions tasked with capturing the opponent's castle while protecting their own. Opposing pieces line up on both sides of a row of blue squares representing a river. Minions can move one square to any unoccupied space. Monarchs can move one or two squares in any linear direction and are allowed to capture opposing minions that are two squares away. Monarchs can jump over their own minions but cannot jump over an opposing minion unless they capture (sacrifice) their own on the other side. A player wins by moving their monarch onto the opposing castle space from two squares away.

151753.name: The Nobility

rpg.21870: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures

151753.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first free addon for Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures!

Rules for playing noble characters.
Six new Character Playbooks, including the Nobleman's Wild Daughter and the Novice Templar.
A selection of NPCs for the castle.

151754.name: The Goblin Infestation

rpg.21870: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures

151754.description:
From publisher blurb:

The third free addon for Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures!

A new Scenario Pack which pits the characters against a tribe of wicked goblins infesting the area around the village.
Rules for randomly generating your own set of goblin warrens.
Expanded rules for making goblin tribes.

151755.name: What Lies Beyond

rpg.21870: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures

151755.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our friend Colin Chapman has made this extended bestiary for games of Beyond the Wall. Here you will find many new monsters, as well as rules for making the lords and ladies of the undead.

151757.name: The Cartographer's Annual 2012
151757.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to ProFantasy's Cartographer's Annual Vol. 6 providing you with a dose of creative content for Campaign Cartographer 3 and its add-ons. Each month the Annual will provide you with something new and special for your mapping endeavors: a mapping style, symbols, a collection of maps, and many other things. Overland Satellite View: Style Packs: CC3's new features make it easy to set up a collection of tools that produce a new and unique style in your maps. The hard part is often coming up with the original idea and design. The Cartographer's Annual aims to produce a wide variety of such styles to give you an out-of-the-box way to make your maps look fresh and serve as inspiration for your own designs. Jon Roberts' Cities Style: Each style pack is accompanied by a mapping guide which tells you how to use the templates, drawing tools and symbols and takes you step-by-step through the creation of an example map in this new style. Symbols: Occasionally the Cartographer's Annual will provide new symbol sets designed to create a specific type of map or to supplement an existing set. Dungeon Diorama Tiles: Map Collections: Some types of maps crop up again and again in role-playing games: taverns, caves, small villages and their ilk. The Annual will supply example maps for these that can be quickly adapted to your own needs. It will also include ideas and suggestions for encounters and adventures in those locations.

151758.name: Deadlands Noir GM Screen With Adventure
151758.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a full-color 3 panel landscaped format GM Screen that comes with the 32 page full-color adventure, The Old Absinthe House Blues.

151759.name: The Deadlands: Noir Combat Maps: Mississippi Bayou
151759.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Contains a double-sided, erasable, gridded poster map for Deadlands Noir, any roleplaying or miniatures game.

151760.name: City Streets
151760.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Contains a double-sided, erasable, gridded poster map for Deadlands Noir, any roleplaying or miniatures game.

151761.name: Deadlands Noir Action Card Decks
151761.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The action in Deadlands Noir comes fast and furious. Keep up with the flying lead and sizzling mojo with these two gorgeous 54-card decks designed by three-time Hugo award winning artist Cheyenne Wright.

151762.name: Il Campionato dei piccoli Geni
151762.description:
Trivia game with more than 5000 questions. Subjects of questions: Science, art and entertainment, English, geography, history, literature, general knowledge, mathematics.

3 rounds. In the first round all players answer questions, making points for a correct answer. In the second round, players face off in pairs. The fastest to book answers the question posed by opponents. Last round the player make a question to his left player, changing player until each player has placed a question. The best two player go to final round made by 10 other questions. The winner will be the player who correctly answers the most questions placed.

Contents:
1 board
8 pieces
32 cards
462 cards
Rules

151763.name: Marvel Puzzle Quest
151763.description:
Iron Man! Thor! Wolverine! And Puzzle Quest! We’re taking on our biggest challenge yet - full design and development for Marvel Puzzle Quest: Dark Reign! Step into the Marvel universe and assemble a team of legendary super heroes within the Dark Reign storyline, one of the most impactful comic events in Marvel history.

Demiurge is working together with Marvel and D3 to ensure an authentic Marvel experience for players. The game features strategic match-three gameplay that powers deep RPG mechanics and shows off your favorite Marvel characters. And our Demiurge twist? Team-based squads of heroes, a first for the Puzzle Quest series. The game also features a deep leveling system, fast and intuitive gameplay, player-vs-player and more!

Source: The Developer Website.

151764.description:
From the Kickstarter campaign:

Special order cards are half-pizza orders to be completed like regular order cards, but with at least five topping discs.

Includes 15 special order cards
151764.name: Top This! Special Orders Expansion

124647.name: Top This! A Pizza Flicking Game

151765.description:
From the Kickstarter campaign:

Chilies can be added to your order and reward the player completing that order with an extra Tip card.

Includes 5 hot chili topping discs
151765.name: Top This! Hot Chilies Expansion

124647.name: Top This! A Pizza Flicking Game

151766.description:
From the publisher's website:

Five new ways to keep you chewing,
illustrated by five fabulous guest artists:

Sam Bosma
Nathan Bulmer
Domitille Collardey Adebimpe
Lisa Hanawalt
and Dustin Harbin!

Cards included:
Fern
Chicken Finger
100% Organic Wedding Cake
Mouthwatering Memories
Athlete's Foot
151766.name: Guts of Glory: Bonus Artist Cards

151767.name: Anduin (Issue 76 - Sep 2002)
151767.description: This Western-themed issue contains a Deadlands scenario, a barebones description of a town in the wild west, generic Western NPCs, a short and humorous chooseable path solo adventure, several articles (about cowboys, the Inka, GM advice, and more).

151768.name: Narrators Screen (Star Trek)
151768.description:
From the back of the book:

The Narrator's job can be daunting at times. The STAR TREK NARRATOR'S SCREEN is designed to make your job as Narrator much more smooth and enjoyable. Packed with all of the most important charts, tables, and forms from the RPG, the STAR TREK NARRATOR'S SCREEN is one Product no Narrator should be without!

THE STAR TREK NARRATOR'S SCREEN INCLUDES:
> A beautiful, full color, four-panel Narrator's Screen
> All of the game's most important tables and charts
> All of the forms a Narrator needs to create and run a STAR TREK series
> Eight ready-to-use full-color character sheets

151769.name: Anduin (Issue 77 - Oct 2002)
151769.description: With three adventures, a short indoor LARP, several articles, and - as usual - recipes, reviews, comic, this is an especially long issue with lots of content.

151770.name: The Manor (Issue 5 - Nov 2013)
151770.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #5 of The Manor is here and full of old school gaming fun. Inside you'll find:

Four nasty Villains to populate your game.
A batch of horrible concoctions to throw in your treasure chests. I guarantee they will never assume what's inside a potion bottle ever again.
A tavern name generator. Let it do your thinking for you.
A consumer report on dungeon doors. It's good to know the pros and cons before spending a single coin on a door that doesn't meet your needs.
A table of city encounters that can quickly generate adventure hooks or make a boring errand into an event.




Go ahead and knock on the Manor door, I'm sure someone will be home. We have fresh cocktails waiting. Don't pay attention to the screams. I'm sure they'll fade eventually.

231304.name: La Cosa Nostra: Guns For Hire

151771.description:
In La Cosa Nostra, you take on the role of a mafia boss. In the beginning, you control a crew of gangsters and a couple of businesses. During the game, you will hire new gangsters to do the dirty work and collect your money. Investments lead to new lines of business or monopoly positions: take control of the drug dealing, moneylending or prostitution. Bribe politicians and cops, invest your money in night clubs, casinos or the waste management industry. To get the big deals, you need to cooperate with the other families — but never rely on those "friendships". The others will take the first opportunity to stab you in the back, so you better do it first...

Each player controls gangster cards that serve to either gain money or attack other players. Actions are planned secretly, placed face down, then played in turn. Often you need certain business cards to succeed. If you don't own them yourself, you can negotiate deals with the other players. The players bargain, spy, threaten, and deceive each other.

Each of the four rounds brings new action cards into the game, and the number of gangsters increases. Thus, the possibilities for actions become more diverse, the jobs more profitable, and the attacks more powerful. Co-operation gets more attractive and treason alluring because at the end of the day money is the only thing that counts.
151771.name: La Cosa Nostra

151772.name: Treffpunkt Mars
151772.description:
The goal of the game is to reach Mars or Venus or both. To extend the playing time, it can be agreed upon if it's necessary to return to earth. The game is played with 3 dice. Upon arrival on Mars and Venus the players get wooden cubes, representing valuable metals. The player who gets the most cubes wins the game.

The game was published in the 50s or 60s.

151774.description:
These is a designed sticker to give more life to the meeples of Rampage.
It was a give away for the buyers of the game in Essen 2013.
151774.name: Rampage: Meeple Sticker

151775.description:
50 black stories: crimes, corpses, murders, suicides... How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults.

One player reads the introduction (written on the front of the card) aloud. The other players try to reconstruct the whole scene (written on the back of the card) by asking yes-no questions, guessing and fiddling about.

A spooky card game just right for any party.
151775.name: Black Stories 9

151776.description:
50 black stories: crimes, corpses, murders, suicides... How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults.

One player reads the introduction (written on the front of the card) aloud. The other players try to reconstruct the whole scene (written on the back of the card) by asking yes-no questions, guessing and fiddling about.

A spooky card game just right for any party.

This is the second box of Black Stories dedicated to Christmas.
151776.name: Black Stories Christmas Edition 2

151777.name: Wicked Fantasy
151777.description:
publisher blurb

Wicked Fantasy began as a series of articles in Kobold Quarterly Magazine reinventing the “standard races” in fantasy roleplaying. Now, those same articles have been expanded and revised (five times their original size!) and fit with the PATHFINDER Roleplaying Game.

A brand new PATHFINDER setting book that puts a twist on the "classic" fantasy races. Wicked Fantasy is a brand new setting book focusing on ten races. It has been a year-long project for myself and Gillian Fraser, re-creating the "generic" races found in most fantasy roleplaying games. We re-designed humans, elves, dwarves, gnomes, and halflings, and then turned our attention to orks, gnolls, ratmen, goblins and kobolds. Ten races, all with a wicked twist.

151778.name: Neorude
151778.description:
User Summary

A console JRPG designed primarily for use with the PlayStation Mouse. Play with the controller was supported, but difficult.

151779.name: Motorbike Madness
151779.description:
From the inlay

It's trials time and you take the role of an ace rough-track rider. Competing against real or computer-driven opponents on a series of tricky and dangerous courses, can you consistently achieve the best times and walk away with the prize money?
The action takes place on the mountains - on the roughest, meanest slopes imaginable, and features courses made up of hazards that will test the brains, courage and biking knowledge of the most experienced trials rider. You are the best in the league - can you keep that position?
Steer your machine around treacherous obstacles including pools of water, abandoned vehicles, slippery poles and strategically placed jumps, but take care - just as in real life, damage to your bike affects its performance. Repairs cost money ... when you've won a contest, the last thing you want to spend the prize money on is a new set of shock absorbers!

User Summary

Unlike what is suggested in the inlay, this is a single-player only game on all formats.

151780.name: Xbox One Wireless Controller

videogamehwversion.227121: Day One Xbox One Wireless Controller

151780.description:
User Summary

The Xbox One Wireless Controller is an evolution of the Xbox 360 Controller.

Changes include a new force-feedback system called Impulse Triggers, with increased numbers of rumble motors, allowing more directional feedback. The battery pack is more flush to the rear, the D-pad has been improved and the controller features LEDs that allow the Kinect sensor to identify it's location. The radio link has been upgraded to allow a greater data-transfer rate, thus increasing the quality of audio through headsets plugged into the controller.

Controllers packaged with the Day One edition of the console featured the text "Day One 2013" on the front.

151781.name: AquaPazza: Aquaplus Dream Match
151781.description:
Aquapazza: Aquaplus Dream Match (アクアパッツァ アクアプラスドリームマッチ) is a 2011 2D arcade fighting game developed by Examu. It is a joint collaboration between Aquaplus and Leaf, who developed all the titles and featured characters. The "Dream Match" in the title references the characters of the game coming together from various Aquaplus titles, including Utawarerumono, Tears to Tiara, and To Heart.

Source: Wikipedia, "Aquapazza: Aquaplus Dream Match", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

151782.name: Hausnummer
151782.description:
Paper-and-pencil game where from 2 to 4 players using pencils of different colours must throw a die and write the thrown values on an 8x8 board, forming numbers that will be scored when a row or column has been totally filled.

In their turn, a player must throw a die and write the value on one square of an 8x8 board, as far from the side of the board as the value shown in the die (1 is the border and so on). The value can be written as a first digit (tens) or as a second digit (units) in a number. The round ends when a row or column of the board has been filled up with numbers, all having a second digit and at least one having a first digit. Players will then score the numbers in the row or column that are fully in their colour; it's possible to "share" numbers but they won't score.

A whole game consists of several rounds: three for three players and four for two or four players.

151783.name: Imagination
151783.description:
Imagination is a party game of charades in which players compete vs. each other.

Each round one of the players becomes a game master. He draws two top cards of the deck and checks the number of the next top card (which is random from 1 to 10). Then he looks at the text lines ("tasks") with this number and chooses a task from one of those cards. Next, he chooses an action how to explain the task to other players: to speak, to draw, or to perform. (The method of explanation becomes unavailable for this player till he uses all three methods in his text turns.)

All other players tries to guess the task. The game master and the player who gives the correct answer both score 1 victory point, keeping one of the two task cards drawn by the game master. After that the next player becomes a game master, and so on. The player with the most number of cards is declared the winner at the end of the game.

200 two-sided cards (with easy and difficult tasks on opposite sides) contain 4000 different tasks.

151784.name: Europa Universalis II: Asia Chapters
151784.description:
Europa Universalis II Asia Chapters is based on the successful Europa Universalis II engine and featuring everything that the original EU II has with historic events from 1419 to 1820. In addition, brand new events focused on the grand Asian campaigns in the same period were added to broaden the historical coverage of the game, and thus give players an exciting new experience of assuming the Asian roles.

Source: The Publisher Website.

151785.name: Crusader Kings II: Sons of Abraham
151785.description:
Europe is in turmoil. The land has been fragmented into petty fiefdoms, the Emperor struggles with the Pope, and the Holy Father declares that all those who go to liberate the Holy Land will be freed of their sins. Now is the time for greatness.

Crusader Kings II: Sons of Abraham is the fifth expansion for the critically praised strategy/RPG , focusing on the Abrahamic religions; Christianity, Islam and Judaism.

Source: The Publisher Website.

151786.name: The Fungus Kingdom
151786.description:
In The Fungus Kingdom, you search for mushrooms in forests and other dark places, then sell them in the kingdom's marketplace and to itinerant traders who appear periodically. With the assistance of various "masters", you could become the most successful collector/dealer, thereby obtaining the most money possible through your sales — and thus the most victory points (VPs). Of course to do this you must fight for the best seats with trade partners and ensure good relations with them.

Each player starts the game with an individual player board, six workers, six gold, and a mushroom card. By placing the appropriate number of workers on the various action spaces, you can purchase mushroom, land or water; buy or implement demand or master cards; purchase new warehouses or assistants; and produce or sell mushrooms. Players can hold five cards in hand from one round to the next, and after nine rounds players tally their VPs to see who wins.

151787.name: Barbarians
151787.description:
From publisher blurb:

Characters in rpgs often have abilities are not tied to their class, race or skill, although they may be related/useful to it. These are called Feats.

They may be combat related, a way to tweak spells or even to do with the crafting of an item. Some will be useful to almost everyone, others only in very certain circumstances.

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about feats for Barbarians, those rage filled engines of destruction and battle. They work on improving existing features of the barbarian and are often rage related.

Feats include:

Clearer Mind
Decreased Fatigue
Improved Animal Fury
Improved Defence
Improved Trap Sense
Increased Rage Duration
Increased Will
Rapid Rage Recovery
Rapid Movement
Screaming Rage

151788.name: Mythos
151788.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fifth volume in our Mythic Monsters series, Mythic Monsters: Mythos brings you a dozen and one alien horrors from beyond the stars! Twelve of your favorite eldritch abominations are here, updated for the mythic rules, and when we say updated we mean complete stat blocks, yes, but more than that every unearthly and indescribable Thing from Beyond has its own unique and exciting new mythic abilities, from an mythic shantak’s disemboweling flyby to the temporal retribution of a mythic hound of Tindalos!

This product includes mythic oozes of familiar alien horrors like the gibbering mouther and shoggoth as well as more obscure alien creatures like the faceless stalker and moon-beast, covering CRs from 4 to 24. In addition to a dozen existing otherworldly foes, Mythic Monsters: Mythos also enumerates every creature from the official Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Bestiaries (and a few more besides) that qualifies for the mythos descriptor, as well as mythic path abilities for alien alchemy and the mysterious Elder Signs, plus four mythic alchemical compounds to spice up the laboratory of your favorite deranged researcher of the cosmos. To top it all off, Mythic Monsters: Mythos introduces an entirely new 13th mythic monster, the swift and deadly mythic greater byakhee, a star-spanning mount, minion, and menace perfect for the summoning rituals of your local cosmic cultists!

The Mythic Monsters series from Legendary Games brings you dynamic and exciting mechanics alongside evocative and cinematic new abilities that really help creatures live up to their flavor text, whether they are creatures of real-world myth and legend or creatures born out of the RPG tradition itself. These creatures can work just as well in a non-mythic campaign as they do in one that incorporates the full mythic rules, as you can throw them at your jaded players who think they’ve seen it all or know the standard monster stats as well as you do. That look of surprise and “What was THAT?” will warm any GM’s heart.

151789.name: Riigimehed
151789.description:
Board game based on TV-serie.

Roll the dice and move on the game board. In special boxes draw cards with special actions: like "other players move 2 steps back" etc. Who finishes first is the winner.

There are many events based on real scandals happened in Estonian politics on the cards.

151790.description:
Superfut is a football game for two players. The aim of the game is to score a goal against your opponent and to defend your own goal, using a die to make your moves. The player who scores more goals wins; in the event of draw, the winner can be decided by penalties.

In start of the game, players place their footballers on the game board, either using the standard formations on the tactics cards (recommended) or by taking turns. On his turn, a player rolls the dice to move his footballers with or without the ball on the board or shoot. Footballers may be moved horizontally, vertically or diagonally. It is possible to kick, pass and dribble. To score a goal, the ball has to be kicked over the line in front of the opponent's goal mouth.
151790.name: Superfut

151791.description:
Set of 2 extra cards for Cryptozoic's The Lord of the Ring: The Two Towers Deck-Building Game, given out by participating board game stores:

- Éowyn: another playable hero, bringing the amount of heroes to select from to total of 8. Card text: "Human Hero / You start the game with 'I Fear Neither Death Nor Pain' in your deck."

- I Fear Neither Death Nor Pain: new card for starter deck for player with Éowyn as hero. Card text: "Name a non-Starter Card type, and then draw the top card of your deck. If the named type, +1 Power."
151791.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Deck-Building Game – Éowyn Promos

142555.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Deck-Building Game

151792.description:
Two oversized promo cards for use with the Special Scenario - Taking Back the Town.

Includes: 1 Construct Zombie and 1 Scenario Card.

For use with the "If I'm Going Down" Dying Card Game.
151792.name: If I'm Going Down: Taking Back the Town Promo Cards

151793.name: Vagabonds Core
151793.description:
UNPUBLISHED PRODUCT




it appears this Item will never be published
this Item has been moved to (Unpublished Products)
there should be no product images submitted to this entry





from the game site

Vagabonds is a tabletop roleplaying experience designed and authored by Nicholas Cladis and published by Tiny Altar Games. Set in a fantastic version of Japan’s Edo period, Vagabonds seeks to simulate the wide-ranging adventures and misadventures of wanderers and ragtag outcasts.

Vagabonds Core is the one book players need to successfully run a campaign in the Vagabonds game world. The book contains detailed setting information regarding Edo period Japan. It also provides players with campaign creation guidelines/scenarios and a variety of character options. The system found in this rulebook is unique to the Vagabonds role-playing experience.


admin comment
this Item was moved to (Unpublished Products) on August 31, 2016

151794.name: Root Down
151794.description:
Root Down is a 2-player abstract strategy game played on a standard 8x8 square game board.

The main mechanic is that all of a player's pieces flip from a state where they can move (kickers) to a state where they cannot move (roots) after every move. The kickers must also be next to a root in order to move, and the number of spaces they move is also determined by the number of kickers next to each root.

151795.name: RIF (Resistance is Futile)
151795.description:
Science fiction skirmish level miniatures rule set.

From the publisher's web site: "Ideal for use with 28mm or 15mm scale miniatures (so can use 40k armies with these if you like), the rules cover heroes, vehicles, individuals and units as well. They handle armoured vehicles, gunships, power armour, aliens, humanoids, bugs, robots…

A player shoots and/or moves a unit or individual/model, then rolls to see if he can activate another unit that round, and so on until a roll to get another unit to act fails, then the other player has a round. The chance of getting 2+ units to respond in a round depends on the motivation, communications and the like for the unit/individual/model involved... but it a case of shoot first, then move, then combat.

Morale includes a form of pinning/going prone as a voluntary action against incoming fire to reduce the risk of, erm, death, and the main element is that all units/individuals/models start to test once a certain level of casualties have been sustained by your army (not per unit). Level of losses at which you test is worse for militia-type units, better for regulars and much better for special forces.

A points system is included in the rules, as well as ideas for linking games from one to another."

151796.name: The Baleful Sorcerer of Tsathag'kha
151796.description:
From publisher blurb:

What if you want to play a sinister student of the black arts like in a sword-and-sorcery pulp?

This is an alternative (and old school, in my opinion) magic-user class for those who want something a little different, influenced by Clark Ashton Smith. The Baleful Sorcerer of Tsathag'kha is compatible with the original fantasy roleplaying gameand RPGs of such ilk.

151797.name: Blade & Crown
151797.description:
From the back cover:

Combining the best of classic games and modern innovation, Blade & Crown includes:


A unified mechanic using a few ten-sided dice and a single twelve-sided die for almost all rolls
Options and encouragement for every player to take narrative control, including Traits that motivate, guide and focus immersive roleplaying
Combat that walks the line between realism and heroism: gritty enough to make combat dangerous, but survivable enough to make adventuring fun, and with tactical options to make combat as abstract or concrete as you want
Magic that is mysterious and mystical
Religion that is flavorful and compelling
Complete rules for designing characters, doing tasks, buying & selling, researching and employing magic, practicing religion, conducting combat, traveling and more – everything is contained in this volume
Extensive GM notes
A sample campaign seed, "The Gift Map", and deck plans for the cog The Jade Swan, and dozens of adventure seeds
Character sheets and reference forms


Blade & Crown is ready for adventure! Are you?

151799.name: Hessaret's Treasure
151799.description:
From the back cover:

There’s something rotten in the town of Advent

Advent - the last civilised place in The Realm before one crosses into the barbarian lands of The Long Riding. Many years ago this was a lawless place of warring clans and murderous bandits. Advent has grown since then, but little has changed. It still attracts the dregs, the runaways, the refugees, the desperate, the unforgiven.

Perhaps this is why Zarand and his gang of robbers thought Advent was a good place to lie-low. To plan the next job. To find the fabled treasure hoard of the barbarian chief, Hessaret.

But naturally, nothing is ever so simple.
This might just be Zarand’s last job...

Hessaret’s Treasure is a RuneQuest 6th Edition scenario set in The Realm, the lands described in Book of Quests. It provides a side chapter for that campaign or, as is intended, a scenario in its own right. While useful, Book of Quests is not essential to play, and this scenario can be easily slotted into many fantasy campaign settings.

151800.name: Dwarven Vengeance
151800.description:
Dwarven Vengeance is a game book in the "to go left, turn to page 378" style.

Back cover blurb:

You've lost your home, your family and your future.

When you woke to find a dragon smashing through the gates of the underholm and goblins swarming in the corridors your first thoughts were of survival.

Then the anger came, and the thirst for revenge and the need to get your home back.

So starts the quest to find the Dragonbane, a mystical item that is your only hope to defeat the dragon.

151801.name: Oddly Obvious!
151801.description: Oddly Obvious is the wild new party game where the answers are all IN YOUR FACE. We GIVE you the clues. We GIVE you the ANSWERS. Just be the first person to identify the most correct answers on the card to win.

151802.name: Cloudberry Kingdom
151802.description:
Cloudberry Kingdom is a platform game created by Pwnee Studios. The game uses a set of algorithms developed by Jordan Fisher to create procedurally generated levels that can be adaptive to player skill level, in game character abilities, and alteration of game physics.

Cloudberry Kingdom is a downloadable title for Mac OS X, Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3, PlayStation Vita, Wii U and Xbox 360.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cloudberry Kingdom", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

151805.description:
A 33" x 17" player mat used to organize your game of Warfighter.

The mat goes in the center of the table and organizes the Location card path, Action deck and discards, Hostile deck and discards, and Sequence of Play!

Originally thought out to be 22" x 17" but it wasn't going to be large enough: While it could technically hold all the cards and information, it looked cramped.

boardgameaccessory.149951: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game

151805.name: Warfighter: Player Mat

151806.name: Eldritch
151806.description:
The Game

Eldritch is a Lovecraftian action roguelike. It is available now for Windows, Mac, and Linux.

What is Eldritch?

Eldritch is a first-person action game inspired by roguelikes, immersive sims, and H. P. Lovecraft.

- Unearth ancient secrets and find your way to freedom!
- Sneak, fight, and explore strange worlds!
- Invoke mystical powers to augment your play style!
- Randomly generated levels provide fresh challenges and opportunities!
- Unlock shortcuts to jump directly to deeper dungeons!

Source: The Game Website.

151807.name: IMBA
151807.description:
Broken, busted, over-powered and imba; just some of the common phrases you hear when playing some of your favorite competitive video games. Are you tired of playing video games that release patch after patch but still never seem to get the character balance correct?

IMBA to the rescue!

IMBA is the board game where you take the role of lead game designer of a popular competitive video game. Your job is to make sure your video game has been thoroughly tested and that all the characters in your game are balanced.

IMBA is a card game for 2 to 4 players. Each player will be assigned a different character to balance and its up to you to stand out as the best designer by making sure the characters you're in charge of are not too strong, not too weak and free of exploits.

151808.name: Brave Sparrow
151808.description:
publisher blurb

"You’re a sparrow, brave and terrified. Brave Sparrow is an alternate reality experience, a journey toward recovering your wings." - author's site

user comment

Players participate in this solo game by collecting tokens of their true Sparrow nature and testing their courage with missions of personal growth. This game is part of Joe McDaldno's "Little Games" patronage series.

151810.name: Bad Myrmidon
151810.description:
An old-school adventure for levels 1-3.

Publisher's Blurb

"Cowardly Achilles has hidden his treasures in a temple on the island of Leuke. The undead Sisters of Penthesilea want vengeance, the Myrmidons want to protect the temple, and the Amazons want to kill the Myrmidons.

Outside the temples, forest fires rage in slow-motion; feathered viragos stalk hapless men; madfolk torture and burn each other; and nude cultists preach love, tolerance, and self-mutilation. This island is damned, and those who voyage here are damned as well. But treasure awaits!

Bad Myrmidon is an old-school adventure to benefit Mandy Morbid. All proceeds will go directly to her so that she can continue her battle against Ehlers–Danlos syndrome. A bad Myrmidon, for a good cause!"

151814.description:
This card is part of Fantasy Flight Games' Season 1 Android: Netrunner League Kit. It is functionally identical to the Crypsis card in the core box set, but features alternate, full-bleed art (no border).

Each league kit contains two of these cards - 1 for the winner and 1 for the organizer.
151814.name: Android: Netrunner – Alternate Art Crypsis

151815.name: Stack Three
151815.description:
Stack your blocks and get three in a row! Block your opponent by placing yours on top. Stack Three will challenge your spacial reasoning as you try to think through stacking. First player to get three blocks connected wins.

Objective: To lay three touching blocks in a row horizontally, diagonally, or vertical diagonally.

151816.description:
This card is part of Fantasy Flight Games' Season 1 Android: Netrunner League Kit. It is functionally identical to the Melange Mining Corp. card in the core box set, but features alternate, full-bleed art (no border).

Each league kit contains 17 of these cards - 1 for each the 16 league participants and 1 for the organizer.
151816.name: Android: Netrunner – Alternate Art Melange Mining Corp.

151817.description:
This card is part of Fantasy Flight Games' Season 2 Android: Netrunner League Kit. It is functionally identical to the Scorched Earth card in the core box set, but features alternate, full-bleed art (no border).

Each league kit contains 17 cards; 1 for each the 16 league participants and 1 for the organizer.
151817.name: Android: Netrunner – Alternate Art Scorched Earth

151819.description:
This card is part of Fantasy Flight Games' Season 2 Android: Netrunner League Kit. It is functionally identical to the Kate “Mac” McCaffrey card in the core box set, but features alternate, full-bleed art (no border).

Each league kit contains two of these cards - 1 for the winner and 1 for the organizer.
151819.name: Android: Netrunner – Alternate Art Kate “Mac” McCaffrey

151820.name: Check
151820.description:
Can you tell when someone is bluffing? Roll your stones and up the ante until someone cracks and calls check. Did you bluff well enough or will you lose your stones? Keep your stones to win!

To play, you and your opponents start with six stones, three green, three blue. Each stone has two sides, flat and round. Players take turns guessing how many of one type of stone is existing collectively. If someone feels the guess is wrong they may call the player out. If they are right the active player loses a stone and the player who called it starts the next round. Last one standing wins.

151821.name: Ivy
151821.description: Need a game that challenges your memory? Test out your math skills with Ivy! In Ivy player take turns trading, collecting, and stealing pogs from one another to get the winning number. Can you remember what number you have?

151822.name: Islands
151822.description:
In Islands you will use strategy and creative concepts to win. You will need to attack and defend in order to conquer. Move your characters over the path you have created and jump your opponent to send them away. Leave them stranded without a path to win!

Contents: 40 "rocks", 20 marbles, game board, instructions, and storage bag.

151823.name: FIVEs
151823.description: Roll the die for your letter and make up a funny sentence using the words letters. The first player to guess your word will get the letter you rolled. Spell out the word FIVEs and win!

151824.name: Sechser Vorteil

boardgameversion.227209: Spiele mit Stift und Papier edition

151824.description:
Paper-and-pencil game where from 2 to 4 players must score the most possible points by enclosing spaces of an 8x8 board. Three extra dice are required.

Each player throws the three dice in their turn and chooses any combination of these dice of which the sum equals 6; these values are then written on vertically or horizontally consecutive spaces of the board. When an area of the board has been enclosed, the player with the biggest amount of border spaces in their colour fills the enclosed spaces with dots in their colour; if there is a tie the spaces remain blank until a space in the area is filled and the tie is broken. Areas including spaces on the border can include two spaces at most.

When every space on the board has either a number or a dot the game ends; the player with most dots wins. An alternative scoring method is offered: dots score two points and border spaces score one point.

151825.description:
Legends of Andor: New Heroes includes four new heroes for Legends of Andor, and these heroes can be used either with the base game or with The Star Shield expansion. With the new rules in this expansion, you can now play the game with up to six players. The new heroes are:


Bragor/Rhega, a Tarus from Sturmtal
Arbon/Talvora, a renegade keeper of the black archives
Fenn/Fennah, tracker from the Southern Wood
Kheelan/Kheela, warden of the Riverlands


Also included is the "Brother Shield", and whoever carries this can exchange strength with one of the other heroes on the board twice. It can also be used as a normal shield.

This expansion includes new creature boards that strengthens the power of creatures when playing with five or six players. The drunken troll wanders aimlessly through the lands and pushes a creature along his path when he meets one, and the Dark Heralds make the boss creature stronger.
151825.name: Legends of Andor: New Heroes

151826.name: Freedom Flyer
151826.description:
From publisher blurb:

Folk do what they can to scratch out a living in the ’Verse. Seems like some folk push their luck to scrape by in these tough times. Maggie Miller's bad history and rotten luck are keeping her from achievin’ her dreams. She wants to get out of the Georgia System to make a fresh start out on the Rim, but she needs three things to do it: a hidden pile of cash, a ship she’s hidden with an old flame, Hollis Mason, and enough leftover credits to wipe Ma Millers’s medical bills clean before she goes. The Crew will have to dig for treasure, outwit a wily Alliance officer, and steal a ship hidden in orbit to help Maggie safely on her way. Trouble is, there’s a kind of hitch: Hush Jackson, a tough-as-nails bounty hunter who’s hopin’ to cash in on Maggie’s head. Will the Crew turn Maggie over for the bounty? Or, will they help Maggie out and pray there is enough cash left over to cover their costs?

Frieedom Flyer is part of the ECHOES OF WAR roleplaying adventure series, which is centered on a common theme: the Unification War. ECHOES OF WAR adventures include basic rules to get you started employing the Cortex Plus game system. Main characters are found in Serenity Crew, which is available separately. All releases in the ECHOES OF WAR line are compatible with the upcoming FIREFLY ROLE-PLAYING GAME, which is based on the television series by Joss Whedon.

151827.name: The Lost Unicorn of Oz
151827.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ceros is a young unicorn who fell to Oz from the sky, and now need the Heroes' help getting home. However, the things Ceros says to them about Oz make no sense, and hint that his home is both far away, yet startlingly closer than anyone thinks.

Meanwhile, Old Mombi is trying to recover her lost magic, and a pendant belonging to the young unicorn may be her means to getting it back, and to finally have her revenge on Princess Ozma.

The Lost Unicorn of Oz is an adventure for Instant Oz, the quickstart rules for the Heroes of Oz RPG. Inside this PDF, you will find:

A complete adventure in Oz featuring the four Heroes from Instant Oz
Write-ups for Ceros and Mombi, plus a filled-out Hero Record for Ceros, in case anyone wants to play him
New Rules: Cutaway scenes, involve players in side plots while inconveniencing their Heroes and enjoying it!
Safehouse: an optional encounter for any Oz adventure featuring Lady Sockyarn.

151828.name: Heroes of Oz: Santa Claus
151828.description:
From publisher blurb:

Santa Claus, the patron saint of children and master toymaker. He is known the world over for his generosity and love of children. L. Frank Baum, author of The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, chronicled his life in the book The Life and Adventures of Santa Claus and in the short story A Kidnapped Santa Claus.

151829.name: Heroes of Oz: Santa Claus (Fate Accelerated Edition)
151829.description:
From publisher blurb:

Santa Claus, the patron saint of children and master toymaker. He is known the world over for his generosity and love of children. L. Frank Baum, author of The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, chronicled his life in the book The Life and Adventures of Santa Claus and in the short story A Kidnapped Santa Claus.

And now, Baum's version of Santa Claus is presented for the popular Fate Accelerated Edition rules. These stats are based solely on the FAE rules available from Evil Hat, so he can slip right into your favorite FAE game with little trouble, that is, if your game's characters believe in him.

151830.name: The Cave System
151830.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 1”=5' battle map of a cave system. It could be used with any game system, though fantasy gaming systems and settings were the target. I have intentionally left the spaces within the cave system predominately generic (meaning no Goblin Lord's throne, no rooms with chests of treasure, no skeletons of dead adventures, etc.) so that any GM's that use this can fill each room with whatever their heart desires, and to ensure that this map will be compatible with as many systems as possible.

Features:

80" x 80" in size. That's almost 7' of gaming space squared!
HEX and SQUARE grids for each type of map listed below. Each one is sized to be 1" = 5' of gaming space.
Full Color Version – This is a printer intensive, full color version of this map.
Printer Friendly Full Color Version – This version reduces the load on your ink cartridges by replacing inaccessible earth areas with blank white space.
Black and White version – A black and white version that replaces the inaccessible earth areas with blank white space. Meant to be the least printer intensive of all of the maps.
Natural looking cavern, with mossy floors, bioluminescent mushrooms (which provide the light that feeds the moss), stalagmites, and even an underground river. There is also a bridge that crosses the river, allowing access to the other side of the map.
Intentionally generic so that this map is useful with multiple gaming systems and/or settings, and so that GM's can create their own stories within these caves and fill it with whatever monsters, treasure, traps, or challenges they wish.

151831.name: Kos City

rpgsetting.25506: Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting

151831.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the world of Kos and to Kos City, the first volume of the highly-anticipated Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting!

This book contains descriptions of 50 different specific places that can be used either individually or in conjunction with one another, and within the context of the city of Kos as presented here or as part of any other community a storyteller might have established within their own campaign setting. It also includes a fully-keyed map of the city of Kos, both in the book and as a separate 11 x 17 file that can be printed out on a single sheet of paper.

The Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting has deliberately been designed to be system free, not tied to any particular game setting, and to be compatible with any set of role-playing game rules suitable for ancient, medieval, or fantasy venues. In that the setting was used as the playtest backdrop for games using the OGL/d20, Pathfinder, “Basic” Dungeons & Dragons and Labyrinth Lord retroclone, and Advanced Dungeons & Dragons rules, of course, it is an especially ideal setting for them.

151832.name: Telekinesis
151832.description:
From publisher blurb:

This series of ebooks explore the varied ways that a single spell can be adapted into new spells.

This first ebook in the series explores telekinesis, offering a wide range of new spells of 1st to 5th level that expand the options for this underused spell and open the way for its use by lower level characters. Within its pages are to be found the following:

27 Spells of the telekinesis type.
5 new feats for practitioners of telekinesis.
A new feat that offers a way of making telekinesis more accessible to wizards without them having to fill all their spell slots.




Spell Themes: Telekinesis is spell sourcebook compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

151833.name: Bugbear Hide: Classic Monsters Reskinned
151833.description:
From publisher blurb:

Big, dumb animals aren’t scary. Sure, they can bite and claw and do other nasty things to hurt you, but there’s no innate malice there. Those sorts of creatures are just going about their business, doing what they do, and the adventurers unfortunately get in the way. The scary monsters are the humanoids, the ones who have personalities and motivations and very specific goals. They have bad intentions. They hold grudges. They’ll actively set out to mess you up.

It’s also easier to keep the roleplaying in a roleplaying game when you can interact with a genuine villain on a level other than swinging a sword, shooting and arrow, or casting a spell at him. You can kill a big dumb animal by rote, without feeling much more than a sense of security that it won’t hurt you or anyone else ever again. You can’t kill a humanoid that’s acted with intention, that’s made it’s personal, that you’ve had an actual conversation with, and not feel something. Anger, jealousy, disgust, a craving for justice, something. Humanoids are where the juicy, character-driven stories are at.

That’s why humanoids have always been my go-to monsters. Sure, I have encounters with other types of creatures, and work to make them as thrilling and challenging as possible, but the heart of every story has a person. When I need a wandering monster, it’s usually humanoids wandering around for some logical reason. When I need to adjust a challenge rating, I add in as many humanoids as needed. They’re flexible foes, and whether you’re in a city, a forest, a swamp, under the the sea or deep below the earth, it’s always easy to find a story context for them to be there.

As a gamemaster, the problem with humanoids is the same as with any other monster — players read the books. They know what to expect, and they know how to defeat any standard-issue creature you throw at them. A band of orcs? Yawn. Drow? Soldiers or nobles? Our job as gamemasters is to mix things up, keep players on their toes and keep the game interesting. Slaughtering the 500th kobold of the current campaign doesn’t get you there.

That’s why I put together the Monster Hide series. Each of these short, no-frills PDFs brings you 5 stat blocks for variant and alternate monsters, of one humanoid type. Mix and match them with the standard-issue foes to give your players some surprises. What do you mean, I hit it with an arrow for max damage and it’s still standing? What do you mean, the orc is 9 feet tall? Hold on, did you say the drow’s eyes were glowing red?

151834.name: Die Goldenen Hände Suc'naaths und andere Abenteuer
151834.description:
user summary
This PDF contains a reedition (from the original in Cthuloide Welten magazine) of 3 scenarios focussing on the 1920s.

These are:

Die Goldenen Hände Suc'naaths
a scenario in Berlin, containig strange phrases from the bible

Soweit die Träume tragen
a scenario that leads to the Dreamlands

Staub zu Staub
a scenario in Lovecraft Country

151835.description:
Qwixx: Das Kartenspiel captures the spirit of Qwixx — with players still trying to cross off numbers in four colored rows as best they can — but this game uses cards instead of dice, allowing for more tactics and planning as you draft and play a hand of cards.

As in the original game, in Qwixx: Das Kartenspiel each player has a scoresheet with the numbers 2-12 in rows of red and yellow and the numbers 12-2 in rows of green and blue. You want to mark off as many numbers as possible, but you can mark off a number only if it's to the right of all marked off numbers in the same row. The deck has 44 cards, eleven in each color numbered 2-12; the back of each card shows the number but without the color. Each player starts with a hand of four cards, and four other cards are laid out face-down — that is, with the color hidden — in a row beside the remaining deck of cards.

On a turn, a player fills her hand to five cards by drawing from the four cards on display, then refills the card display from the deck. Using the number now visible on the top card of the deck, each player can choose to cross off one instance of this number in one row on her scoresheet. The active player then plays 1-3 cards from her hand, all of which must be the same color. She can cross off the numbers on these cards — but only if at most one number is missing in the series of numbers to be crossed off. For example, if she discards 2, 3 and 5 in blue, she can cross off these three numbers (assuming that she hasn't crossed off any blue numbers previously); if she discards 2, 3, and 6 in blue, then she can cross off the 2, the 3, the 2 and 3, or the 6.

If a player has crossed off five numbers in a color, then she can cross off the rightmost number (2 or 12) should the opportunity arise; if she does, she also crosses off a lock token in this color. If the active player can't cross off a number during her turn, she must mark a penalty box.

When a player has "locked" two colors on her scoresheet or marked off four penalty boxes, the game ends. Each player tallies her score in each color — the more numbers crossed off, the more you score — then sums these totals and subtracts any penalty points. Whoever scores the most points wins!

For a variant, Qwixx: Das Kartenspiel includes eleven multicolored joker cards, also numbered 2-12, that are shuffled into the deck. A player determines the color of this card only when playing it on her turn.
151835.name: Qwixx: Das Kartenspiel

151836.name: Chicken Cha Cha Cha
151836.description:
Chicken Cha Cha Cha!

The award-winning memory-training board game for up to four kids now available for iPad! Lovingly crafted by TheCodingMonkeys, creators of quality digital board games like Carcassonne or Lost Cities.

Kids aged 4 and up race animated chickens around a meadow, all while training their visual memory. Who will be the first to collect all tail feathers and cackle in triumph? Parents are invited to play and test their memory skills, too! Chicken Cha Cha Cha has won several awards for Best Children's Game in Germany, France and Finland, including the prestigious "Game of Year" (Spiel des Jahres). It helps to train visual memory and concentration - essentials skills in child development.

With "Guided Access" the app can be locked down for kids and plays can be limited. An instructional video is available here.

Source: The Game Website.

151837.name: Gipsy King
151837.description:
Based on the board game “Gipsy King” from Cwali.

You are a caravan leader, trying to be the gipsy king by placing the caravan in the free lands near the wonderful lakes. After all the lands are filled with caravans, players will score points.
Points are scored for controlling lakes with gold coins and connected caravans groups.
After first round of filling the map, a second round is executed (with some minor changes). The player with the most points after these two rounds, is the winner and is crowned as the Gipsy King.
Can you be that player?

151839.name: Cars: Cool Twists Starter Game Set
151839.description:
The Cars Game System combines gaming and modeling: Players first assemble their favorite characters from the Disney/Pixar movie Cars, then they race them head-to-head on a customizable race track! Players must maneuver their cars for the best position and collect special bonus tokens that give them an extra boost during the race.

The Cars: Cool Twists Starter Game Set includes two character models (1:43 scale, some assembly required) complete with stickers: McQueen and Francesco. Also included are modular track tiles, special ability tokens, character cards, and dice.

The game can be expanded by adding additional cars from other model kits (sold separately), allowing up to 6 players total.

151840.name: Decktet-Uno
151840.description:
Decktet-Uno is inspired by Uno mechanics and it's a game in the family of Decktet games.

Each player chooses a card and places it on top of the face-up card at the center, starting to form a pile.

Each time a card is played by someone, that player gets awarded a total of points calculated as:
[Number of symbols on the face-up card on the top of the pile] X [Number of matching symbols on the card the player is placing on top of it]

After playing a card, the current player finishes the turn and draws a card from the deck.

The game goes on until all cards have been played.

151841.name: BioShock Infinite: The Siege of Columbia – Handyman Figure

132428.name: BioShock Infinite: The Siege of Columbia

151841.description:
Bioshock Infinite: The Siege of Columbia – Handyman Figure is an extra handyman for the founder player. It was released in the Ultimate Songbird Edition and Collector's Edition of the video game. Initially, this figure had no rules associated with it, but the publisher has since instituted the following rule:

Founders may have up to four Handymen on the board at the same time. Whenever the founder player has four Handymen on the board, the Vox Populi player has the following ability: "Once per round you may discard an action card from your hand to search your discard pile for a card of your choice, show it to the other player, and place it into your hand. You may not search your discard pile for the Airship card."

151842.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 48 - Dec 2013)
151842.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #048: December 2013

Cover: Andrew Boulton

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller's web site.

151844.description:
The Planes Game System combines gaming and modeling: Players get to assemble their favorite characters from the Disney movie Planes, then race them through a airplane obstacle course! Players must try to avoid collecting "penalties" and use their special maneuvers to impress the race judges!

The Planes: High Pilotage Starter Game Set includes two character models (some assembly required) complete with stickers: Dusty Crophopper and Ripslinger. Also included are racing "gates", penalty tokens, Planes model stands, character cards, and dice.

The game can be expanded by adding additional planes from other model kits (sold separately), allowing up to 6 players total.
151844.name: Planes: High Pilotage Starter Game Set

151845.name: No Crowns
151845.description:
From the publisher:

Sean Patrick Fannon (Shaintar, Star Wars: Edge of Darkness) unleashes the struggles of democracy and free market capitalism in a high fantasy world. Discover the answer amid the greed, passion, and power plays of No Crowns.

The PDF says it takes place in Shaintar and recommends downloading the free Shaintar:Legends Arise: Players Guide (Revised Edition) for additional setting information.

151846.name: Ferret
151846.description: Ferret is a quick and fun coin-flicking game of great skill for two or more players, with each player controlling one coin on the board. They must get their coin to hit the Ferret (another coin) on their turn and can additionally attempt to block or attack their opponents. The last man standing is the winner of the round, with a full game usually consisting of a number of rounds.

151847.name: That's What She Said Game
151847.description:
Welcome to that's what she said game, the party game of twisted innuendos! This outrageous party in a box has players matching hilarious red setup cards to the funniest white phrase cards.

Play it pre-funk, post funk... ANY-funk! Make it wild with that's what she said game!

151848.description:
As Neil DeGrasse Tyson says, "We have a one-way ticket" to an expanding universe, and so it is with EONS: Cosmic Expansions, a set of three expansions for EONS that adds three distinct expansion decks that can be used together or individually, in conjunction with the base game.

Cosmic Bodies, expansion 1, expands the EONS universe to include Orange Dwarves, Asteroid Fields which the players can "throw" at other players to destroy planets, and Binary Star Systems. Cosmic Technology, the second expansion, grants civilizations the ability to colonize other planets with fewer resources or become space-faring and no longer vulnerable to player action. Finally, Cosmic Destruction adds a Rogue Black hole that is high victory points, but has to be fed element cubes or the player loses their victory points. It also adds a Red Supergiant, which becomes a black hole when destroyed and the brown dwarf, which try as it might, will never make star status and will die after a set number of rounds.

Together, these expansions give EONS more options in both competitive and cooperative play and has shown to decrease both the PvP and play time of the game, due to players making more strategic decisions that affect themselves instead of others, in an effort to use the new cards that are very valuable to build towards.

EONS: Cosmic Expansions also includes more cooperative scenarios and adds printed secret agendas to the game, so it is almost five expansions in one small box.
151848.name: EONS: Cosmic Expansions

151849.name: 6 Iron Spikes & a Small Hammer (Issue 1 - Jun 2013)
151849.description:
6 Iron Spikes & a Small Hammer
Issue #1
June 2013

The Sandbox of Dr Moreau

151851.description:
December 2013 Game Day promo

Cost: 2 Rune
Value: 1 Honor
Effect: Gain 2 Power, then you may banish Disciple of Sadranis. If you do, you may defeat Monsters in the void as though they were in the center row this turn.
151851.name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Disciple of Sadranis Promo

151852.name: Gundam Breaker
151852.description:
User Summary

Gundam Breaker is a Mobile Suit Gundam game that combines Gundams from many different eras into one game. It is an action game that has the player controlling a model Gundam that he/she can modify with different and more powerful parts earned by destroying enemy Gundams and collecting items by completing missions. Parts affect a number of different stats such as mobility, attack power, range, health, and shields.

There is a network mode that allows up to four players to attempt missions together with their custom Gundam models.

151853.name: Beamstrike
151853.description:
A free science fiction miniatures skirmish game. From the rules introduction:

"Beamstrike - The miniatures game - is a set of fast paced, simple, science fiction war-game rules for tabletop battles using 15mm model miniature figures. A wide range of armoured vehicles can be fielded, from Tanks, to Walkers and Mecha. Rules for alien races, including generic ‘bugs’ and ‘greys’, add interest, and full rules allowing robots and androids complete the sci-fi repertoire."

151854.name: Tactic
151854.description:
User Summary

Tactic was originally released for the Acorn Archimedes by Eterna Software. It was converted to the BBC Micro series of computers in 1993 by Andrew Pepperell and released by Superior Software as part of its Play It Again Sam 17 compilation.

The game is similar to Tetris or Columns in that objects fall from the top of the screen. In this game these are either circles or squares of different colours. The player can move them left or right as they move down the screen before resting at the bottom.

At the bottom of the screen are a series of target shapes. For example it could show three objects on top of each other, or five in a cross pattern, etc. The object of the game is to pile up shapes of the same type and colour in the patterns shown. To clear a level, the player must match the correct number of patterns.

In the BBC version, there is a simultaneous two player option.

151859.description:
The fourth quarter 2012 Android: Netrunner Game Night Kit includes:


One Android: Netrunner promotional poster
Two demo posters to identify play areas for new players (one Corp, one Runner)
Eight sets of seven faction-themed deck dividers
Two sets of seven custom, faction-themed, acrylic tokens
One high-quality Android: Netrunner playmat for champion of the tournament to be held during the 4th quarter of 2012. Same artwork as the cover of the base set game box.
151859.name: Android: Netrunner – 2012 Fourth Quarter Game Night Kit

151860.description:
Playmat for champion of the tournament to be held during the season 2 tournament for Android Netrunner.

The artwork depicted is Running Interference.
151860.name: Android: Netrunner – 2013 Season 2 Champion Playmat

151861.description:
Playmat for champion of the tournament to be held during the season 3 tournament for Android Netrunner.

The artwork depicted is Project Vitruvius.
151861.name: Android: Netrunner – 2013 Season 3 Champion Playmat

151862.description:
Contents:

1 playmat for champions of the 2012 World Championships. The artwork depicted is Modded.
1 Cyberfeeder deckbox
4 sets of 7 acrylic identity cards




Note: Playmat distributed as consolation prize in some 2013 Regional Tournament Kits.
151862.name: Android: Netrunner – 2012 World Championships Kit

151863.description:
Full kit contents:

8 Full-color Android: Netrunner The Card Game playmats for champions of the 2013 Regional Championships. The artwork depicted is Project Beale.
16 sets of 7 Regionals exclusive acrylic click tracker tokens (112 tokens total)
4 plastic cards that have runner on one side and corp on the other. HB has no runner on the back.
1 “Scorched Earth prize” - Playmat or deck box from the FFG archives for the last place player
A large 5’ x 2’ ‘Regional Championship 2013’ banner to be displayed at the venue
1 Regional Champion 2013 trophy
1 World Championship Weekend ticket
151863.name: Android: Netrunner – 2013 Regional Championship Tournament Kit

151865.description:
Contents:

1 Crypsis messenger bag
16 Crypsis playmats
1 Vulcan Coverup playmat
Alt-art Eli 1.0 - door prize
151865.name: Android: Netrunner – 2013 World Championships Kit

151866.description:
Playmat for champions of the 2014 Store Championships

The artwork depicted is Wotan.
151866.name: Android: Netrunner – 2014 Store Championships Playmat

151868.name: Grandia: Digital Museum
151868.description:
Grandia: Digital Museum (グランディア ～デジタルミュージアム～ Gurandia Dejitaru Myuziamu) is a role-playing video game developed by Game Arts and published by ESP Software for the Sega Saturn.
